articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Air India plane headed to London with 242 people on board crashed minutes after taking off from India's western city of Ahmedabad on Thursday, the airline and police said, without specifying whether there were any fatalities.
articles.title: Air India plane with 242 on board crashes at India's Ahmedabad airport

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Sandra Strojanovic
articles.description: California will face off with Washington in court on Thursday over President Donald Trump's deployment of U.S. troops in Los Angeles after demonstrators again took to the streets in major cities to protest Trump's immigration crackdown.
articles.title: Marines prepare for Los Angeles deployment as protests spread across US

articles.author: Marisa Taylor, Nandita Bose
articles.description: The role of Elon Musk's SpaceX in an ambitious new U.S. missile defense system is in question following the dramatic feud last week between the billionaire entrepreneur and President Donald Trump, according to three people familiar with the project.
articles.title: Exclusive: After Trump feud, role of Musk's SpaceX in Golden Dome missile shield in question

articles.author: Francois Murphy, Parisa Hafezi
articles.description: Tehran announced counter-measures, as an Iranian official said a "friendly country" had warned it of a potential Israeli attack.
articles.title: UN nuclear watchdog says Iran in breach of obligations, Iran announces counter-measures

articles.author: Crispian Balmer, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: At least eight Palestinians who worked for the U.S-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation died in an ambush, the GHF said on Thursday, blaming Hamas militants for the killings that rocked the troubled food distribution operation.
articles.title: Humanitarian workers killed in Gaza ambush blamed on Hamas; internet cut in territory

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Protests in the Kenyan capital Nairobi intensified on Thursday, with vehicles set ablaze and police firing teargas to disperse crowds angered by the death in custody of a political blogger last week, Reuters TV footage showed.
articles.title: Vehicles ablaze in Nairobi as Kenya protests escalate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un attended on Thursday the launching ceremony of a warship that had been damaged upon its first attempt to launch, state media KCNA said on Friday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un lauds restored destroyer, says more to be built

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Thursday that drones had played a major role in the conflict in Ukraine and called for the rapid development and deployment of separate drone forces within the military.
articles.title: Russia's Putin calls for quick development of drone forces

articles.author: Jonathan Landay
articles.description: The number two U.S. diplomat questioned the need for NATO in a post on X - which he later deleted - as the alliance prepares for an annual summit expected to be dominated by a U.S. demand for higher defense spending and Russia's war on Ukraine.
articles.title: No. 2 US diplomat questions need for NATO in deleted social media post

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rioters attacked police with petrol bombs, rocks and fireworks in the Northern Irish town of Portadown on Thursday, a Reuters witness said, as a fourth night of anti-immigrant violence moved to a different part of the British-run province.
articles.title: Police attacked as Northern Irish violence spreads to another town
